alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Curry County Coast; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 28 at 8:15PM PST until March 01 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 1000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow above 1000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Accumulations will be highest in the higher terrain of Curry and Josephine counties, including the Kalmiopsis Wilderness. Most of the area will receive up to an inch of new snow tonight, but the larger impact will be from the freezing of wet roads. * WHERE...Curry County Coast, Central Douglas County, Eastern Curry County and Josephine County, Eastern Douglas County Foothills and Jackson County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Curry County Coast; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County
